questions.text: Custer's defeat at Little Big Horn is commonly associated with Sitting Bull, but another Indian Chief also played a key role in the battle.
questions.explanation:
Crazy Horse.

	I guess he didn't have a P.R. man!

questions.text: Lee Oswald is famous as the alleged assassin of JFK. Who else is Oswald believed to have killed?
questions.explanation:
J. D. Tippitt

	Tippitt was the cop who got shot. Hosty and Hill were government agents. Walker was a right-wing military man that Oswald may (or may not) have taken a shot at - unsuccessfully.

questions.text: Jesse James (and brother Frank) are associated with the failed raid into Northfield, Minnesota. What other well-known badman was also involved?
questions.explanation:
Cole Younger.

	Younger also had brothers along. (Depending on the age of the brothers, they were either the younger Youngers or the older Youngers.)

questions.text: The disappearance of Amelia Earhart is the stuff of legend. Who else disappeared with her?
questions.explanation:
Fred Noonan.

	He was the navigator.

questions.text: The eruption of Mount Vesuvius destroyed Pompeii; it also destroyed another area. Which?
questions.explanation:
Herculaneum.

	A suburb, I believe. Santorini and Thera - the same place - may be the site of Atlantis.

questions.text: Speaking of destruction, Charles Manson is known as the murderer of Sharon Tate ... but she was not the only victim. Which of these was another victim of the crime spree?
questions.explanation:
La Bianca.

	I hope I spelled that right. The others are suspected of being Jack the Ripper.

questions.text: John Wilkes Booth was the assassin of Abraham Lincoln... but others were also involved in the conspiracy. Which person was NOT a conspirator?
questions.explanation:
Boston Corbett.

	Payne (also known as Powell) and Atzerodt were caught. Surratt escaped capture, but his mother was hanged. Corbett is credited with shooting Booth.

questions.text: Speaking of the Lincoln assassination, other individuals were also targets of the conspiracy. Which individual was also attacked and injured by Booth's men?
questions.explanation:
William Seward.

	Seward was injured in a knife attack. He recovered. Johnson was a target, but was never actually assaulted.

questions.text: William Wallace was lionized in 'Braveheart' for his role in the Scottish struggle against England. There was, however, another important figure involved.
questions.explanation:
Robert the Bruce.

	Not given due credit in the movie, Bruce is a national hero.

questions.text: The battle at the Alamo cost Davy Crockett his life; Jim Bowie also perished. Neither one, however, was in charge of defending the garrison. Who was?
questions.explanation:
William Travis.

	Don't bother with the movie ...
